p: Among the 152 primary outcomes 31 (20 %) were patient-important outcomes (mainly mortality, 25/31) but only 6 (4 %) were patient-centered outcomes assessed after ICU discharge (functional disability = 4; quality of life = 2). Among the 801 secondary outcomes, 169 (21 %) were patient-important outcomes (mainly mortality, 117/169) but only 52 (6 %) were patient-centered outcomes assessed after ICU discharge (quality of life = 22, functional disability = 19; neurological/cognitive performance = 7; handicap = 2; post-traumatic stress = 1; patient satisfaction = 1).
